result.execSummary:
The defendant Troy L. Schmidt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Troy L. Schmidt was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Troy L. Schmidt is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Troy L. Schmidt was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Troy L. Schmidt was found guilty of 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: CONCURRENT to Ct. 2, BUT CONSECUTIVE to 95CF39 (Waukesha Co.), 95CF514 (Racine Co.) and 94CF44611 (Milwaukee Co.)

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment, Psychiatric/Psychological.   Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.

supervisions.notes: CONCURRENT to Ct. 1, BUT CONSECUTIVE to 95CF39 (Waukesha Co.), 95CF514 (Racine Co.) and 94CF44611 (Milwaukee Co.)

superMiscConds.notes: /****AS OF 12-12-17 COURT HAS VACATED THE DNA SURCHARGE ON THIS COUNT.  -  JOC IS AMENDED ***

records.addlTxt:
State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Andrew Burgoyne. DE appears in custody with Atty David Celebre.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  1100 - Parties have rec'd and reviewed PSI. ADA Burgoyne files proof of repeater enhancers. Sentence recommendations. Ct1:  Defendant is sentenced to 3.5 years in the WSP; 1.5 years Initial Confinement followed by 2 years of Extended Supervision concurrent to Ct2, but consecutive to 95CF39 (Waukesha Co.), 95CF514 (Racine Co.), and 94CF44611 (Milwaukee Co.).  DE (is not) eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program but (is) eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  Ct2:   Defendant is sentenced to 10 years in the WSP; 5 years Initial Confinement followed by years of Extended Supervision concurrent to Ct1 but consecutive to 95CF39 (Waukesha Co.), 95CF514 (Racine Co.), and 94CF44611 (Milwaukee Co.).  DE (is not) eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program but (is) eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. Court costs ordered.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
State of Wisconsin and Kenosha County appears by ADA Andrew Burgoyne with KSD Dep. J. Wilke. DE appears in custody with Atty David Celebre.   Clerk P. Scypta.  ** Court reporter changed at 10:30am to Ellen Walfoort. Verdict taken by Sue Armbruster. **
MINUTES:  904 - Sequestration requested by Atty Celebre - ST stipulates. ST's case resumes. Witnesses sworn and testified: KSD Sgt. M. Pittsley, KSD Dep. A. Schmit, Kenosha County Forensic & Analytic Chemist Megan Johnson. ST rests and reserves the right to offer lesser-included charges at the time of conclusion of case. DE rests. Court conducts colloquy with DE re: right to testify. DE waives rights to testify. Evidence closed. Exhibits 6-22 offered and rec'd by the Court. ST offers 2nd degree recklessly endangering safety as a lesser-included offense. Atty Celebre believes case law cited does not support the lesser-included offense. Discussion held. Court shall only consider lesser-included offense if original offense is found to be not proven. Closing arguments. Case to be recalled at 3:30pm. Case recalled at 253. Same appearances. Court issues verdict/decision. Ct1: Guilty. Ct2: Guilty. Ct3: Not guilty. Judgment of Conviction ordered as to Cts 1, 2 - acquittal as to Ct3. PSI ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 26, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Exhibits P1 through P22 inventoried and stored in Br 1 exhibit room on 9/15/17. To be destroyed after retention period. vm

State of Wisconsin and Kenosha County appears by ADA Andrew Burgoyne with KSD Dep. John Wilke. DE appears in custody with Atty David Celebre.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  937 -   Victim rights compliance. Atty Celebre reports DE wishes to waive jury trial and move forward with a trial to the Court. Court conducts colloquy with DE re: rights to trial before a jury. Court finds DE has waived his rights to jury trial and shall proceed with a trial to the bench - ST waives jury. ST presents case relying on criminal complaint as opening statement. Witnesses sworn and testified: KSD Dep. J. Wilke. Exhibits 1-5 offered and rec'd by the Court. Exhibits 6-8 marked but not offered. Testimony to resume at 9am. 
  Court trial scheduled for September 12, 2017 at 09:00 am.
in Limine filed by ADA Burgoyne
in Limine filed by Atty D Celebre
NO RECORD MADE. Case to proceed as #1 trial on 9/11.
Demand for Discovery filed by ADA Burgoyne
Jury selection on September 11, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Date of JT changed by the court. JS set for 9/11 @ 9, JT 9/12 @ 9, JSH 9/7 @ 1pm. Attys notified and confirm by email. New writ to be prepared.

Attorney Zachary Brost appeared for the State. DE appears by phone from PdC Corr, and by Atty David Celebre. Dr. Engen appears by phone.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  133 - DE makes a claim of incompetence. Parties are prepared to proceed. Parties sworn and testified: Dr. Christina Engen. Atty Celebre objects to the Court's receipt of doctor's report - requests Dr.'s position be limited to testimony only. ST requests admission of report. Court does receive doctor's report and makes a finding that the DE is competent to proceed. Matter set for trial. All witness lists and motions are due by 5pm on 7/17/17. DE to be writted for trial. All TR matters to trail.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 10, 2017 at 01:00 pm.  Jury selection scheduled for August 14, 2017 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 15, 2017 at 09:00 am.

State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Andrew Burgoyne. DE appears by phone from PdC Corr. and by Atty David Celebre.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  823 - Atty Celebre reports he does not have an expert to contradict the existing finding of competency in the previously filed reports. CH to be held, and doctors/DE may appear by phone.  Competency hearing scheduled for May 23, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Phone appearance scheduled on 4/13 @ 4:20pm with Renee @ PdC by voice mail.

State of Wisconsin/Kenosha County appears by ADA Andrew Burgoyne. DE appears by phone and by Atty David Celebre.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  858 - Atty Celebre reports a second eval has not yet been performed on the DE. Funding/expert witness report is at issue. Adjournment requested. Granted.  Status conference scheduled for April 28, 2017 at 08:15 am.
Left voice mail with Katrina(?) from PdC for phone appearance. **Call confirmed with Renee @ PdC.**

State of Wisconsin appears by Deputy District Attorney Angelina Gabriele. DE appears by phone from PdC Corr. and by Atty David Celebre.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  1011 - Report filed. Atty Celebre takes issue with final conclusion of doctor - second evaluation requested by Atty Celebre. No objection by the State. Atty Celebre shall get new authorization through SPD for eval. Adjournment requested - granted.  Status conference scheduled for March 28, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Competency report from Wisconsin Forensic Unit.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Def. appeared by phone from Prairie du Chien Correctional, with Atty David Celebre in court.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Case is not resolved and Atty Celebre requests adjournment; no objection by the State.  FPT 2/16/17 at 1:45; def. to appear by phone.  Bond continued.

State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Andrew Burgoyne. DE appears by phone from Prairie du Chien Corr and by Atty David Celebre.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  1118 - Atty Celebre has just recently been appointed on this case - adjournment requested for file review. Granted. DE to appear by phone unless requested by Atty Celebre or DE for a writ.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 20, 2016 at 09:00 am.
to withdraw and order  -  Atty Caspari moves to withdraw

MINUTES:  245 -   Victim rights compliance. Atty Caspari has filed a motion to withdraw. Motion is granted. New counsel to be appointed by SPD, and matter set for status. DE may be returned to PdC - DE may appear by phone. Atty Caspari to notify SPD of new date.  Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2016 at 11:00 am.

MINUTES: 1001 - Matter set over for status after 10/8.  Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State/County. Atty Caspari appears by phone. No appearance by DE.   Clerk P. Scypta.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in custody with Atty Diane Caspari.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES: 1034 - DE requests an adjournment to review recordings - granted. DE to appear by phone.  Status conference scheduled for July 8, 2016 at 10:00 am.
NO RECORD MADE. Hearing rescheduled to all DE to appear on Writ.  Status conference scheduled for May 27, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in custody with Atty Diane Caspari.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  1026 - Atty Caspari requests adjournment to review case with DE - granted.  Status conference scheduled for April 28, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State. DE appears in custody with Atty Andrea Rufo.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  939 - Matter herd with 14TR5319, 5320 5321, 5322, 5323, 5324, 5325, 5326.  Atty Rufo has filed a motion to withdraw for reasons set forth on the record. DE is still eligile for SPD, but one has not yet been appointed. Court grants motion to withdraw. Atty Rufo to notify SPD for new atty.  Status conference scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 10:00 am.
to Withdraw as Counsel of Record filed by Atty Rufo
DE will be moving for new counsel per Atty Rufo. DA notified by email.
And demand for discovery - filed by ADA T Braun.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in custody with Atty Andrea Rufo.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES: 909 - Matter heard with Kenosha County files 14TR5319-14TR5326.   Victim rights compliance.  Atty Rufo requests trial, as no question of competence remain with the DE that would rise to an NGI defense. DE does not object to this court hearing and deciding on all Court orders all witnesses and motions in limine to be filed no later than 1/15/16.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody on writ) with Atty Hilary Edwards (for Atty Andrea Rufo).  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Def. has not undergone psychiatric evaluation as earlier requested by Atty Rufo.  Status conf. 12/10/15 at 9:00, to allow more time for evaulation to take place.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Andrea Rufo.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:14am-  Attorney Rufo is requesting an adjournment to allow the DE to have an evaluation completed by a psyciatrist for a possible competency or NGI issue.  State does not object.  Court grants request.  Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Bond continued.
Attorney Rufo is requesting 6/24/2015 Pre-trial conference be rescheduled - matter is resolved.  Plea hearing scheduled for 8/5/2015 at 8:30am.  Parties notified in court.

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by Attorney Andrea Rufo.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  11:39am-  DE's appearance waived - clerk was unable to contact the DE by phone at the time the case was called.  Victim rights compliance.  Attorney Rufo needs to discuss discovery w/ the DE & requests an adjournment.  Court grants request.  DE may appear by phone for the next hearing.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Bond continued.

Defendant Troy L. Schmidt appeared with Attorney Valerie Stuart Karls.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Jason Robert Zapf appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: DE withdraws his motion for new counsel. The Court defers any action of any other motions subject to discovery of any squad camera video. Matter adjourned; bond continued. DE to appear by phone for his next hearing.  Status conference scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 10:30 am.
